newsitem.title: USA: Borders Group sees 1996 net above estimates.
newsitem.headline: Borders Group sees 1996 net above estimates.

text.p: Borders Group Inc, huge specialty retailer of books and music, said Thursday it expects its 1996 earnings to exceed the analysts' consensus earnings estimate of $1.29 per share.
Borders Group said its expectations for 1996 earnings are based on fourth quarter and year-to-date sales results.
Borders Group reported 1995 proforma earnings of $0.85 before charges related to its spin-off from Kmart Corp.
Earlier, Borders Group reported total sales for the fourth quarter (October 28 through January 5, 1997) period rose 13.8 percent to $617.7 million from $542.6 million the prior year.

By division, Borders' total sales for the period were $282.2 million, a 39.1 percent increase over the prior year. On a comparable store basis, Borders' sales increase was 11.3 percent. Waldenbooks' total sales for the period were $331.3 million compared to prior year sales of $331.1 million, and on a comparable store basis sales rose 2.1 percent.

For the year-to-date period ended January 5, 1997 total sales rose 14 percent over the 1995 period to $1.85 billion. By division, Borders' year-to-date sales increased by 43.7 percent to $898.0 million from $624.8 million. On a comparable store basis, Borders' sales rose 9.9 percent. Waldenbooks' year-to-date sales were $931.1 million compared to prior year sales of $965.5 million. On a comparable store basis, Waldenbooks' sales were flat.
Superstore sales represented 49.7 percent of year-to-date consolidated sales as compared to 40.5 percent last year.
Borders Group is the world's second largest retailer of books, music, and other educational, and entertainment products.

The company said it does not intend to provide more detail regarding 1996 earnings or more precise guidance regarding 1997 until it releases its full-year results in mid-March. ((--Chicago newsdesk +1 312 408 8787))
